instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
threads.message:
This arrived with no liquid damage.Customer claims this was working fine until it was hit by a lightning strike. Fan spins CPU gets warm but no other activity.

With board only on the desk and OSX thumb drive no light appears on thumbdrive.

Already tried a known good bios with clean me but no change. Vcore is 1.8v

Anything else worth checking or does it sound like bad CPU??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
threads.message:
Maybe changing PCH.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
threads.message:
Any cable connected to it, when happened?
PCH should be affected, as having direct connection with I/O interfaces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
threads.message:
3.4 v was measured with board alone on the desk.

Customer claimed was using the machine when it happened.

Should <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> be remeasured with everything connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
threads.message:
I was asking if machine had any external device connected when got the lightning strike.
Not when you've measured on the board.

If doesn't revive changing PCH, then must be bad CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
threads.message:
Changed PCH with a new one but now only right fan is spinning and still no usb activity.

Must be CPU then? Customer decided to get new device before PCH arrived for this one and never answered our question about any external device connected when the strike happened. We still have device here since it was donated to us if you have any more ideas.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no brain
